byline.contributor: Julfikar Ali Manik reported from Dhaka, and Nida Najar from Agra, India.
byline.original: By JULFIKAR ALI MANIK and NIDA NAJAR

abstract: Bangladeshi police say that at least 23 women and children died in stampede in district north of capital Dhaka as large crowd rushed to gather clothes donated during month of Ramadan.
lead_paragraph: More than 2,000 people, most of them residents of slums, had assembled outside the home of a factory owner for the giveaway.

headline.main: Stampede in Bangladesh Kills at Least 23 at Clothing Handout
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; Bangladesh: 23 Die in a Stampede for Free Clothing

snippet: More than 2,000 people, most of them residents of slums, had assembled outside the home of a factory owner for the giveaway.
